verses.text_plain: Through desire a man, having separated himself, seeketh and intermeddleth with all wisdom.
verses.verse_html:
1Through desire a man, having separated himself, seeketh and intermeddleth with all wisdom. ▼
▼ Through…: or, He that separateth himself seeketh according to his desire, and intermeddleth in every business

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Through…: or, He that separateth himself seeketh according to his desire, and intermeddleth in every business
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Through…: or, He that separateth himself seeketh according to his desire, and intermeddleth in every business

verses.text_plain: A fool hath no delight in understanding, but that his heart may discover itself.
verses.verse_html: 2A fool hath no delight in understanding, but that his heart may discover itself.

verses.text_plain: When the wicked cometh, then cometh also contempt, and with ignominy reproach.
verses.verse_html: 3When the wicked cometh, then cometh also contempt, and with ignominy reproach.

verses.text_plain: The words of a man’s mouth are as deep waters, and the wellspring of wisdom as a flowing brook.
verses.verse_html: 4The words of a man’s mouth are as deep waters, and the wellspring of wisdom as a flowing brook.

verses.text_plain: It is not good to accept the person of the wicked, to overthrow the righteous in judgment.
verses.verse_html: 5It is not good to accept the person of the wicked, to overthrow the righteous in judgment.

verses.text_plain: A fool’s lips enter into contention, and his mouth calleth for strokes.
verses.verse_html: 6A fool’s lips enter into contention, and his mouth calleth for strokes.

verses.text_plain: A fool’s mouth is his destruction, and his lips are the snare of his soul.
verses.verse_html: 7A fool’s mouth is his destruction, and his lips are the snare of his soul.

verses.text_plain: The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.
verses.verse_html:
8The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly. ▼
▼ talebearer: or, whisperer
 , ▼
▼ as wounds: or, like as when men are wounded
 , ▼
▼ innermost…: Heb. chambers

footnotes.body_text: ▼ as wounds: or, like as when men are wounded
footnotes.body_html: ▼ as wounds: or, like as when men are wounded

verses.text_plain: He also that is slothful in his work is brother to him that is a great waster.
verses.verse_html: 9He also that is slothful in his work is brother to him that is a great waster.

tokens.text: to him that is a great

verses.text_plain: The name of the Lord is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.
verses.verse_html:
10The name of the Lord is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe. ▼
▼ safe: Heb. set aloft

footnotes.body_html: ▼ safe: Heb. set aloft

verses.text_plain: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city, and as an high wall in his own conceit.
verses.verse_html: 11The rich man’s wealth is his strong city, and as an high wall in his own conceit.

verses.text_plain: Before destruction the heart of man is haughty, and before honour is humility.
verses.verse_html: 12Before destruction the heart of man is haughty, and before honour is humility.

verses.text_plain: He that answereth a matter before he heareth it, it is folly and shame unto him.
verses.verse_html:
13He that answereth a matter before he heareth it, it is folly and shame unto him. ▼
▼ answereth…: Heb. returneth a word

footnotes.body_html: ▼ answereth…: Heb. returneth a word

verses.text_plain: The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity; but a wounded spirit who can bear?
verses.verse_html: 14The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity; but a wounded spirit who can bear?

verses.text_plain: The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge; and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.
verses.verse_html: 15The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge; and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.

verses.text_plain: A man’s gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him before great men.
verses.verse_html: 16A man’s gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him before great men.

verses.text_plain: He that is first in his own cause seemeth just; but his neighbour cometh and searcheth him.
verses.verse_html: 17He that is first in his own cause seemeth just; but his neighbour cometh and searcheth him.

verses.text_plain: The lot causeth contentions to cease, and parteth between the mighty.
verses.verse_html: 18The lot causeth contentions to cease, and parteth between the mighty.

verses.text_plain: A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city: and their contentions are like the bars of a castle.
verses.verse_html: 19A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city: and their contentions are like the bars of a castle.

verses.text_plain: A man’s belly shall be satisfied with the fruit of his mouth; and with the increase of his lips shall he be filled.
verses.verse_html: 20A man’s belly shall be satisfied with the fruit of his mouth; and with the increase of his lips shall he be filled.

verses.text_plain: Death and life are in the power of the tongue: and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.
verses.verse_html: 21Death and life are in the power of the tongue: and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.

verses.text_plain: Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing, and obtaineth favour of the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 22Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing, and obtaineth favour of the Lord.

verses.text_plain: The poor useth intreaties; but the rich answereth roughly.
verses.verse_html: 23The poor useth intreaties; but the rich answereth roughly.

verses.text_plain: A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly: and there is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.
verses.verse_html: 24A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly: and there is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.
